name: Michelle Ma
title: APM @ Yahoo
bio: APM @ Yahoo. Passionate about all things mental/health & wellness. Co-creator of APM Map

name: Katie Goldstein
title: PM @ Microsoft
bio: Hi! I'm Katie, a recent Dartmouth grad from SF. I get excited about pugs, helping others, my Duolingo streak, and Japanese toilets. Let's chat!
path: <https://www.amazon.com/Cracking-PM-Interview-Product-Technology/dp/0984782818> - [Read this book cover to cover to learn more about PMing and prep for PM design questions. I'd recommend you take notes on the different frameworks!], <https://www.linkedin.com/> - [I networked a bunch before starting my role to 1) gain more clarity into the role and company culture and 2) gain useful insights to disseminate during my interviews, and 3) gain referrals.],  <https://www.theverge.com/, https://techcrunch.com/> - [Two great tech news sites that I browse for 5-10 min regularly! Send cool articles to your friends/family/others. Form opinions about things that are happening, and keep track of companies and initiatives that seem interesting.]
journey: Trying to build my LinkedIn presence/give back to the community by hosting weekly Office Hours (https://calendly.com/katie-e-goldstein/katies-office-hours) & overall boosting my LinkedIn posting ability (https://www.linkedin.com/in/katie-goldstein/detail/recent-activity/shares/)!

name: Shruti Ramanathan
title: Product TPM @ Instagram (Facebook)
bio: Instagram Growth&Integrity Product TPM, Georgia Tech grad with a B.S. in CmpEng, California-born and bound, and New Jersey raised! Letâ€™s chat about social good in tech, social psychology, or my obsession with turtles :)
path: https://www.amazon.com/Cracking-PM-Interview-Product-Technology/dp/0984782818: My literal manual to life for the semester I was interview prepping! Highly recommend using this over video interviews to practice a diversity of questions.   https://blog.pramp.com/how-to-succeed-in-a-system-design-interview-27b35de0df26: Thinking about scaling infrastructure is super crucial to acing more technical product management interviews. Better understanding how to approach these questions is not a piece of cake, but highly recommend a computer architecture class curriculum as a foundation.

name: Dasani Madipalli

bio: Iâ€™m and PM @ Microsoft and a career coach. I love doodling, doggos and believe owning our narratives can change the world
path: https://www.tryexponent.com/ -  for interview prep, , https://link.medium.com/86TL6gTNu9 - being a pm at Microsoft,  https://productbuds.co/ - aspiring pm community

name: Lisa Huang-North
title: Product Lead @ Planet
bio: Lisa is a customer focused, data driven product management leader. She is a Product & Program Lead at Planet, the team responsible for delivering product solutions that help customers scale their business. Before joining Planet, Lisa had over a decade of industry experience spanning strategic consulting, finance, digital marketing, and fullstack software engineering. Outside of work, Lisa is an advocate for women in tech through organizations like Women in Product and Tech Ladies. In her free time, you will find Lisa building Lego Technic sets (current build: Land Rover Defender), coaxing her sourdough starter, and dreaming of the day we can travel to see friends & family again.
path: I've compiled resources into this doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NZOOGbisMTocrIZ6dGfcZpmiP89iyiDoxGXtYr5NME0/edit?usp=sharing, which includes 2 resources written by me: "Career pivots: Product Management masterclass"  and "How to stand out from the crowd of aspiring Product Managers
journey: My name is Lisa Huang-North and I am a 2x Founder. I am building products at Planet, a startup with a mission to use Space ðŸ›° to help life on Earth ðŸŒŽ  I will be sharing essays and thoughts on the intersection of Productivity (something Iâ€™ve been reading up & thinking about), Technology, and Social Impact. Sign up for my newsletter here: https://lisahuangnorth.substack.com/p/coming-soon

name: Nancy Wang
title: PM @ Microsoft
bio: I strive to amplify human stories to transform the world around us. PM @ Microsoft / JHU ' 20
path: <https://www.quora.com/q/theartofproductmanagement> - A blog about product management by Jackie Bavaro, co-founder of Cracking the PM Interview, <https://medium.com/agileinsider/navigating-the-entry-level-pm-apm-recruiting-process-957993620ac5> - Comprehensive article on APM/PM recruiting, <https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjm_qVkCPjOVDz9BWjNqO9A> - YouTube channel with everything from mock PM interviews to tips on negotiating your offer!
journey: Currently dipping my toes into writing/reflecting about my thoughts, ideas and experiences on Medium. Volunteering @ Breaktime to help launch the careers of young adults experiencing homelessness, you can check us out and support at breaktime.org! (PS not sure if this text should be formalized or anything bc it totally is not right now HAHA fyi)

name: Kelly Luo
title: APM @ Twitter
bio: apm @ twitter. love talking about pop culture, design, drinking tea.
path: <https://tiny.cc/apm-two-truths-and-a-lie> - [two truths and a lie about apm recruiting: the three things i wish i knew before i started]  <https://www.amazon.com/Product-Manager-Interview-Questions-Answers/dp/0998120480> - [the product manager interview (167 actual q&a's) by lewis c. lin: an in-depth guide for practicing interview questions]  <https://www.intercom.com/blog/tag/intercom-on-product/> - [intercom on product: my favorite podcast series for understanding product management inside and out]  <https://medium.com/agileinsider/navigating-the-entry-level-pm-apm-recruiting-process-957993620ac5> - [navigating the apm recruiting process: a helpful overview of the process from start to end] <https://medium.com/@jackiebo> - [insightful advice and tips from jackie bavaro]
journey: this is a reminder to take a breather and take care of yourselfâ€”you got this! ðŸ˜Š always feel free to say hello! twitter.com/kluo25

name: David Cai
title: APM II @ Yahoo (Verizon Media)
bio: APM by day, SWE at heart, filling my free time with running
path: <https://productsense.carrd.co> - [A card of the news sources I used to develop product sense],<pmtechlessons.com> - [Approachable explainers of tech concepts for non-technical PMs], <http://www.crackingthepminterview.com> - [A classic prep book. I don't really have an allegiance to a particular book, but this is what I used]
journey: <pmtechlessons.com> - [Approachable explainers of tech concepts for non-technical PMs, specifically with an algorithms-focused prep course at pmtechlessons.com/interview-prep]

name: Nelly Lin
title: APM @ Wayfair
bio: Associate Product Manager @ Wayfair & UC Berkeley '19. Passionate about social justice, avid reader and writer, and travel fanatic.

name: Adam Chow
title: Product Manager @ VMware
bio: Adam is a Product Manager for VMware working on the Boxer Mobile Application for iOS and Android. He has also built datemappers.com and has a patent in Machine Learning for Email. Also likes Electric Longboarding as well as 3D printing and photography
journey: datemappers.com - a resource for finding dates around Atlanta, https://www.awoahmods.com/ light up longboard wheels for your electric longboard.

name: Priyanka Maskar
title: Product Manager @ Loop Commerce
bio: Started my journey as an Oracle DBA working on database and technical side for almost 6yrs. Completed my MBA program in 2019 and pivoted my career into Product Management. Being a Product Manager excites me in solving user problems and building delightful products for our customers. I'm looking forward to take on new challenges!
journey: Becoming a Sr. Product Manager and cracking a PM position at FAANG.

name: Nimalen (Nim) Sivapalan
title: APM @ WePay
bio: Hi there! I'm currently an APM at WePay and a recent Cal grad. I love building products that create positive impact, basketball & football, and reading. Getting into PM is hard and I want to pay all the advice/help I received forward by helping you all become great PMs yourselves :)
path: Cracking the PM Interview - your 101 on breaking into PM, Decode & Conquer - excellent guide to frameworks and answering product design/execution/strategy questions effectively, http://productmanagerhq.com/blog - excellent list of PM-focused articles/resume examples/skills/etc, Lewis Lin's Slack Community - great community to do mock interviews with
journey: Currently working on building an online campus hangout for college students at joinpack.app!

name: Aditi Priya
title: Sr. APM at TIBCO
bio: Aditi specializes in customer research and usability, product and project management, cross-functional communications. She is currently the Senior associate product manager at TIBCO, and works combining the best of technology, data and product to execute product vision.

name: David Lietjauw
title: APM @ Twitter
bio: I used to be a sweet potato farmer from Kansas. Now, I'm an APM @ Twitter learning how to build with empathy so we can all experience a more inclusive future. You can find me tending to my succulents~
path: Swipe to Unlock (book) - My friend, Neel, wrote this easy to understand primer on how technology and business work together, www.techmeme.com - Reading the technews everyday helps develop product sense by understanding trends in the industry,  https://www.getrevue.co/profile/caseynewton - The Interface is a newsletter focusing on dialogue around social media and consumer tech by The Verge's Casey Newton, https://constine.substack.com/ - Weekly newsletter over startups and new tech trends by TechCrunch's Josh Constine, https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfAX25ZLrPGRzfILkSd-YiWfsoloCETAe - Bloomberg Technology is a daily 1-hour show where Emily Chang talks about what's going on in tech by interviewing CEOs and talking to experts (I watch this during breakfast everyday!).
journey: My friend Jehron Petty started ColorStack, a non-profit whose mission is to increase the entrance, retention and success of Black, Latinx, and Native American college students in computing. Consider volunteering your time to help the next-gen of diverse tech talent succeed! Visit: https://www.colorstack.org/

name: Umesh Khanna
title: Product Manager @ Hatch Credit
bio: Running the exciting world of small business financing and banking at Hatch. Love to travel (or I guess zoom now?), run and play tetris.
path: Get a mentor, learn how to organize your thoughts, be passionate about something!

name: Sandra Luo
title: Program Manager @ Microsoft
bio: PM working on industry solutions for Microsoft Teams. Passionate about travel, intuitive design, learning peopleâ€™s individualities, and leaving the world a lil more open than you found it.
path: 1. Reach out to your network for referrals! Donâ€™t be shy â€” people usually get referral bonuses if you get hired so they are probably eager to help. Make it easy for them by sending your resume, email address, relevant links, and a casual blurb selling yourself (as if you were in their shoes recommending yourself). Best means of getting your foot in the door is to do this research early and ask your contact to send your resume to the recruiter/hiring manager through their internal means of communication (Slack, company email, etc). This will make your application bubble up rather than getting lost in the application system. 2. https://2by22.blog/definitive-guide-to-behavioral-interview-questions/ A great supplement to Decode and Conquer about acing the behavioral interview questions and leaving an impression with your interviewer. 3. https://www.keyvalues.com/culture-queries End your interview on a strong note by asking the questions that matter to you and show you value culture.

name: Mahmoud Alzaghari
title: Product Manager I @ Redfin
bio: I am a recent Berkeley grad where I studied Cognitive Science and a minor in Computer Science. Prior to Redfin, I was a project manager intern at Cisco, a business development intern at a neurotech startup, and I am a Bay Area local!
path: <https://www.lennyrachitsky.com/p/how-to-get-into-product-management> - [A high level overview of what a PM does, and the paths to get into product], <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ffLxnKkaJ8&list=PLrtCHHeadkHr8ro-vTg1CAdDuwrVmXS4y> - [A Youtube playlist of product interview tips and mock interviews. I used this resource a lot while I was recruiting for product roles], <https://blog.tryexponent.com/tag/product-management/> - [A collection of product management articles that detail what product management is, how to break in, and how to successfully interview for the roles]
journey: Nothing super fleshed out yet, but will let you know as things continue to develop!
